page.title: 02Worlingworth Community Bus
page.content: Q1What is the community bus & why do we ave one? A1Community busses are essential in sparsely populated areas where normal services are uneconomic.Organisers & drivers are voluntary & the services are frequently agjusted to ensure econ- omic use.The bus was bought by grants from local councils but is maintained & replaced from fares & money raising. Q2What are your routs & pick up points? A2The timetable lists runs from Worling -worth to Framlingham,Wickham Market, Woodbridge,Debenham,Stowmarket,Ipswich, Bury St.Edmunds,Norwich,Diss & Eye.Some services are weekly & some monthly.Pick up points,post office,Mill Rd.,The Swan & the church. Q3Who uses the bus regularly? A3People,who due to age or other circum -stances have no access to private transport.
